Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water and light.
Level Description: Proficient (shows most elements clearly and correctly)
CAN: The student can draw a plant with clear signs of health when it gets water and light, such as vibrant green leaves and upright stems.
The student can draw a distinct difference in appearance of a plant that doesn't get enough water, such as wilting leaves or drooping stems.
The student can draw the difference in appearance of a plant that doesn't get enough light, possibly showing a pale or yellowish color in the leaves.
The student can include some details that suggest plants cannot grow or live well without water, like a dried-out plant pot.
The student can include some details that suggest plants cannot grow or live well without light, like a plant in a shaded area looking spindly or weak.
CANNOT: The student may not consistently include precise enough details to show the exact impact of light on plant leaves (e.g., might miss drawing elongated stems for lack of light).

The student may occasionally misunderstand the specifics of how a plant appears when lacking water or light, such as only partially showing dried leaves (student may have partial understanding of drying process).
